<Text>I'm writing to express my heartfelt gratitude to the employees of the midus store at 7340 blackstone ave in fresno. I cant thank the people there enough for what they did for me. They went so far above and beyond I cant even put into words how amazing they were. I needed to have my brakes fixed as another midus did not live up to the standards that have been set by the people at this store and I wanted new tires for my car. Which they were able to help me with. I had an appointment on the 7th of October at 9am, but the night of the 6th, my father went into the hospital and I was told I may only have a few hours left with him. I left the hospital at about 830 in the morning on the 7th so that other family could visit with him, and I could drop my car off. Hearing the situation, I was given a ride back to the hospital completely free of charge, and when my car was ready I was even given an uber back to the shop, where my car was ready and paperwork was ready to get me out of the store in less then 5 mins and to get me back to the hospital as fast as possible. My dad passed later on the night of the 7th.... while my heart is broken with loss, your team of employees, made it where I was able to hold my dads hand, and be there with him for every minute that he had left. I cant thank your team enough for what they did for me. While this has been one of the hardest points in my life, it has been the best from a service stand point. I just want to thank your entire team, I'm sorry I can't remember names right now, my mind is all over the place, it took a few days to even be able to form words, but I just want everyone to know how far the team went out of thier way for me and what they did for me. Also the work they did was great, the new tires and the brakes having them work again means a lot to my family as I am on the road a lot for work. I know I didnt say enough about your team as it is still hard to get my thoughts out lately, but I just wanted to say thank you, and I hope you are able to see how much it meant to me what they did. You have a customer for life, thank you so much.

John Schriner<//Text>< Pictures>

Once dealing with him he was very argumentative and rude with me and I had never experience anything like that before. I decided I would not ever go back. My uncle had service with them a few weeks ago and told me that the store was under new management and that the new guy gave him a great deal on his breaks so I decided to give them another try. I called first and spoke to the new manager Gregory. He was super nice and told me he could get me in right away. When I got there he greeted me with a smile and listed to what I had to say. I wasn't sure what was wrong with my vehicle I just new that it pulling to the right when I was driving. He told me that they would check it out and let me know what was going on within the hour. <name>Joe De Vera</name>< Review>
Dreadful Customer Service

This place is not even worth a single star.  I supposedly to have an oil change and transmission oil change on 12/29/2016 at 5:00p.m.. I was told by Angel Bernabe one of their employee that they are about to close and I should go back the following day. With just oil and fluid change Angel Bernabe said it's not gonna take more than an hour. I took my car in 8:00am 12/30/2016 and explained that I need my car before 12pm since I have other appointments.  I was promised a call by Angel Bernabe when it's done.  2hrs after 10:00am I made a follow up and was told that they were calling me (lies) since I didn't receive any calls. I was told that my radiator "NEEDS" flushing because it's low on fluids.  Radiator is 3 months old since I bought it, complete with all the coolant services with it. I was also told that steering fluid needs flushing which is not possible since I check it every week. Meaning they just want more money from the customer. Again a promise of calling me after the job is done.  it's almost 3 in the afternoon which is  6 hours from the promised time of pickup I showed up in the service center. When they saw me, I was told that they are on the phone trying to make a call to inform me for pickup (lies). I picked up my car and told them how disappointed I am with the service and they just shrugged it off and laugh about it. For the first time check engine light went off. A simple oil and fluid change brought me more headaches and a wasted whole day with all their lies. I would never recommend this Service Center. It was very disappointing.< /Review>

<Rate>5< /Rate><Review>Dinner Nov 28,2018
I am a HUGE fish n Chips fan.
I saw that on Wednesday ,Taste does Fish n chips. In LBC I enjoy fish n chips from Pike/ Roe/Saint &2nd,
BUT NOW there is a new # 1. Taste on Broadway.
Why: fish fresher , firmer , more flavorful.
Batter lighter almost tempura like but one can taste the mild Beer. Hardly any residual oil
Superb Sauce,they call it Garlic Aoli-Jalape√±o
Deee-lish
Fries good too and portions plentiful
Heavenly
Wife had Fried Chicken sandwich that was great also.
Taste has a well thought out Beer and wine list that matched well with the food

Delicious. Great Service!< /Text>

<rating>4<//rating><Pictures>None<//Pictures>< Name>
Jacob Castaneda< /Name>
<Time>1517035131079< /Time>< Text>
I enjoyed this place! The food was pretty good, especially for the price. The service was extremely nice, although our waitress could have come by to offer us water more often. The space is somewhat tight; I would estimate that the restaurant accommodates about 40-50 customers max. Of course parking is a hassle in this part of Long Beach, but there are some spots to be found after a bit of circling.

The burger was very tasty and had some topping that seems like a mixture of caramelized onions and a semi sweet fruit or something. It really enhanced the flavor of the juicy patty! The carbonara flatbread was also quite good, but I wish it had more chunks of crispy pancetta!< /Text>

<user_id>112923256788955138104</user_id>< user_name>
Pete Shieh< /user_name>
< time>
1470258013415</time>
< rating>
5</rating>
<review>A small restaurant in the Belmont Heights neighborhood that seats around 34 people, with a long communal table in the center, this is the place you would take a friend for conversation, special event and eventually catch up over the beer and wine they have here.

Speaking of which, if you come during happy hour 4-6pm, select wines (1 red, 1 white) are $5 and beers are $2 off. Some of the food selections are cheaper (It's a small menu and it's not online).

And if you do like the food and beverage selection, like other restaurants, they will have a beer or wine pairing dinner. Like Phamtom Carriage in the past or the Talley Winery in August.

The food here for the most part is tapa style, small shareable plates. We tried:

Albacore cerviche with the crispy won ton chips-Fresh dish, wished it was a little spicier or saltier, or more acidity. I think I'm used to more in your face flavor.

Indian Fry Bread-4 crispy pieces of fry bread with honey drizzle over them. The baba ganosh and the garlic dipping sauce was nice add on to this dish.

Vietnamese meatballs-7 juicy meatballs with dipping sauce and organic farm greens from Lot59 which is recommended to eat in one bite.  Yup, you guessed it, it tasted like Vietnamese pho or Banh Mi with those similar flavor profiles.

Pan seared Sea Bass with Ratatouille, Summer Garde Herbs, Green Olive-Celery Relish. Love this dish! Super slight crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside with fresh greens.

Berry crumble with pepper ice cream-This dish is not for everyone.  All the dishes here have a good balance of salty and sweet here. The pepper ice cream is overpowering and the berry crumble was, well a bit dry and it elevated the ice cream 3 notches in the pepperyness.

The menu changes here changes constantly as well as the beer and wine choices. So what you see here might be swapped out when you enter the restaurant. However, popular menu items does get brought back periodically.

Also got to try a glass of their tempranillo. Great selection for $8. I do have to say the wine choices here are quite wonderful. The beer selection is about 8 taps. Got to try SinTax from Mother Earth and it was on Nitro as well as the Alpha Galactic from Beachwood. Gotta support local, ya know? They do have a cider too here when I was here and it was called Moonlight Meadery. It was yeasty and tasted like a Berliner instead of a cider which I liked!

Finally, I like to say the staff here is superb. Anthony and Garrett knows the menu super well and takes great care of you.

The bathroom here is beyond the red door and is super big and clean.

4 1/2 for the food and 5 star for the service. Parking is free on the streets. Great place to hang out with time friends. Oh, please note that I was invited here as a guest to try these food and my opinions reflect that of a regular customer.   I will have to come back again!</review><pics>None<//pics>< Response>
None< /Response>

0x80dd31acf019dc85:0xebf865b679b5bdd<//GmapID>
</record>
</dataset><record>

< Review>
Decent experience.  Staff is friendly and good at their jobs.  Office is clean and modern, but it is a stark contrast from the neighborhood its placed in.  Two TVs in the lobby playing children shows usually.

Somewhat of a long wait to be seen, even with an appointment.  You will wait roughly 30m.  Been here a couple times so it seems consistently around 30m.

The biggest downside is that they schedule appointments at least three weeks out, so good luck if you need something done right away or miss your appointment.  The surgeon also only works 2 days a week by their own admission.  You can wait it out and see if they can fit you in, but it will take a few hours.<//Review>

< review>
Bought an R8. Domenico was my point of contact. Excellent price. Exactly as advertised. Up front about everything, even the car's downfalls. I flew in from the midwest to drive it home. It performed exactly as advertised and I look forward to many years of enjoyable ownership thanks to Dom and his team. A disclaimer for any buyer. Used cars are sold as is. Do your research. Ask the right questions. Know exactly what you are getting and plan accordingly. You can find a great deal. No one will answer a question you haven't asked. M sport motors answered all of my concerns thoroughly, but I asked. Dom will be honest and will tell you exactly what you are buying and admit what he doesn't  know. Happy buying, and thanks M Sport Motors. PS: I have to add, the next lowest price I found on a similar car was about $15,000 more.</review>

< Text>
Amazingly transparent, honest and approachable dealership. I had initially gone there with the sole intention of appraising my Porsche 911. However, after a very pleasant afternoon spent with the owner, Brian, not only did I sell Brian my 911 at an absolutely fair price, I also concluded two other separate  deals with him - sale of my BMW 740, and the purchase of a stunning M235. He conducts his business with ethical clarity, opening up his books to show me the auction price he had paid for the M235, reviewing the KBB trade-in and retail prices, and never once pushing or pressurizing me to make a deal. His financial manager, Tim, sourced an attractive financing rate that met my needs. In all, a very rewarding experience at a dealership with excellent high end inventory at most reasonable prices.</Text>

< Text>
The cars on their lot are well detailed and look clean, and the folks working here are sweet, and I truly don‚Äôt mean to stereotype but this is still a used car dealership. I drove a 2014 Subaru WRX with 54k miles on it, and a fair bit of interior wear (more than the average), that was priced at over $24k. The KBB value on the car was $19k, but they insisted on using their own pricing tool that valued that car at $23.5k, and they were not willing to negotiate at all. This would be a good dealership to buy a car that would normally be really expensive at a brand dealership, like a BMW, Audi, or Mercedes, but for something like a performance model Subaru, Honda, or even Mitsubishi, the amount of car you‚Äôre getting for M Sport‚Äôs price, will not be a great value in my opinion.< /Text>

I took my iMac 27 2013 in for repair. It was running like a slug. Over a two week span, my computer got slower and slower until every little task would take a long time. The little spinning wheel just kept spinning! I used my disk utility and did everything I was supposed to with no luck. Apple has everything shut down so I couldn't take it to Apple. I was very lucky to hear about Human Computer. My computer was repaired and updated with a solid state hard drive. My Mac runs like a Jet !
Thank you John for your great and prompt service! I would recommend the Human Computer to anybody looking for good and honest service.< /Review>

<gmapID>0x80dcb0c8bf459acd:0x46a44d1135b3dc86<//gmapID><text>I recently built a computer for the first time and after I was finished, the monitor wasn't detecting the signal. I took it to this place and the people working there said although they aren't able to inspect the motherboard or the cpu, they would at least be able to test the other possible problems, such as the memory, the graphics card, and simply the correct wiring. After not having a computer for 3 weeks, I was desperate for some kind of answer. After approximately an hour or two, they called me and said they found what the issue was and even went to the lengths of showing me that it actually works.

I additionally told them that I was planning on installing Windows 10 via a USB drive and they had me try installing it right there so I wouldn't need to come back. I guess I had the wrong kind of flash drive, so they decided to install Windows 10 for me so I could just type in the Activation Key I had after they were done installing it.

I am currently typing this review on the PC they helped fix, so I can assure you that their services are wonderful and I plan on going there again for a future visit! (They also do data recovery, but they're nice enough to let you try data recovery for yourself before offering you their services.)

Very nice and humble people.</text>< date>
1492903738516</date>

< text>
After several attempts to have human computer fix my laptop they informed me I should buy a new one (which they gladly sold me) as the hard drive was out in mine. I was told the new one was as good as or better than the one I had. After using the new one I released it was not as fast as the old one. I suppose if you know anything about computers this might be the place to go. If you are computer handicapped as I am you might want to go someplace where someone will take the time to explain your options. I have several other problems which I assume is between my chair and keyboard and will just deal with till I find someone to go over it with me. This is why I went to H C so I could get some personal service, unfortunately when I go back in there is another $75--$85 charge to complete what I thought was part of the original agreement .</text>

<Review>This is one small business website I continue to order from. The business owner Renee, is very sweet, knowledgeable and shares a lot of interesting and helpful information about her product range. The products are all natural, made fresh with a small list of all natural ingredients. They run some great promotions too! The soap they have to offer is wonderful, I've tried many varieties. There are often seasonal offerings of special limited products in various natural scents, and some gift sets from time to time. There are also kits, supplies and information if you're interested in trying to make some of your own similar body care products. My favorite product is the Bee Cool Stick, similar to tiger balm, etc. It's convenient to carry with you, and great for aches, pains, headaches, sinus pressure (don't put near your eyes though). I highly recommend her products! Go check out MadeOn Skin Care!</Review>< Rate>

<Rate>5< /Rate>< Text>
I'm a nurse, so my hands take a beating every day between all the pairs of disposable gloves I have to wear and the constant use of strong anti-bacterial soaps and gels. I use the hard lotion bar every night when I go to bed - if I miss a day, my hands start to evidence dry, "tight", and peeling skin between my fingers by the end of my next shift. And the Bee Cool!!!! THE BEST for back pain!!! I've tried 3 other "name brand" products (both natural and over the counter creams and lotions), and none of them come close to the relief offered by the Bee Cool stick! I keep one at home and one in my work bag, since I do a fair amount of bending throughout the day and want to have one handy if my back starts feeling aggravated.

I had a problem with my account and ordering on the website platform, and Renee responded to my inquiry within a few hours with help and some alternative solutions if the first-line fix failed. <time>1523125181990< /time><Rating>5< /Rating><Review>I found the MadeOn Skin Care website a couple years ago through the Wellness Mama blog. I was looking for natural skincare without chemicals or so many ingredients that I have no idea what my skin won‚Äôt tolerate. I have always had sensitive skin and have had ezcema on my legs on and off for over ten years and their products have helped clear it up for good. I used to wake up in the middle of the night scratching my legs in my sleep till the patches were bleeding. I even tried over the counter and prescription steroid creams that never even had any effect. I had several spots the size of my palm on both legs and now only one spot that is less than a quarter that size on one leg that comes and goes. If I was more consistent in applying the products by MadeOn I‚Äôm sure it would go away for good too. During the warmer weather it doesn‚Äôt bother me so much so I forget. I‚Äôve also had bad reactions to antibiotics and cold winter weather (and the dry heat in the home that goes with it). These issues caused ezcema to appear on the tops of my hands and fingers. Sometimes it was so bad my knuckles would become swollen and painful to move my hands at all. MadeOn products helped me survive these issues and healed my hands quickly! There isn‚Äôt any bad choices when it comes to their products but these are my favorites, the Au Chocolat lotion bar, the whipped Shea Butter in a jar, and the goat milk soap with calendula. The Au Chocolat is easy to apply and it feels like it leaves a protective layer on the skin but doesn‚Äôt feel messy or have that cold wet lotion feeling. It smells great too because of the cocoa butter in it. Love that there are very few and natural ingredients in these products. I tried my hand at making something like it (before I found MadeOn) but what I made doesn‚Äôt compare in any way, lol. Even their flip top metal containers for the lotion bars are the best (they are like an Altoid mint container). Easy to open but also stay closed. They even make pocket sized ones too! I keep one in my pocket at work all winter long or during those antibiotics induced episodes. I‚Äôve also given those pocket sized ones away to coworkers and friends who want to try the product and to family as stocking stuffers. This stuff doesn‚Äôt just wash off like lotion would when you wash your hands too. Of course you could wash it off but if you don‚Äôt coat your hands in soap and rub it away it has staying power. The whipped face emollient Shea Butter is so smooth and soft and rich, I use it for my face occasionally but I absolutely would have not survived the antibiotic reaction without it. The tops of my hands from fingertip to wrist were covered in a red bumpy rash that would get hot and crack and burn and occasional even bleed. I used it between the Au Chocolat and especially at night. I would slather a decent amount onto the affected area and put on cotton gloves. I‚Äôve done this for super soft feet too, putting it on under socks before bed. I‚Äôm sure if you have any of the issues I‚Äôve had or even just dry skin or occasionally dry skin MadeOn products will help much much better than a regular lotion. One last note, I never used lotion growing up, my sensitive and combination/mostly oily skin wouldn‚Äôt tolerate it so that habit has not been an easy one for me to create. MadeOn products are much more convenient to use in that aspect too. After I shower I put it on where needed when I put on my deodorant.</Review>< Pics>

<user>111093000825851828707</user><username>Elizabeth Ellson<//username>< Date>
1616627638776</Date>
< rate>
5< /rate>
<Text>Had the most incredible experience today.
Tom greeted me with a smile and a friendly hello. First thing I noticed was how clean and organized the store was. Pricing was clearly marked and mattresses were arranged by brand and displayed neatly.
I explained to Tom how my boyfriend and I are home with 5 kids, and our old sleep number bed was not working for either of us. I went on to list ours must haves for a new mattress.. me with needing something supportive but plush, and him something that would keep him cool at night. Tom was able to find a perfect mattress for us, and made some other recommendations for add ons. (Like the waterproof mattress topper in case my potty training toddler sleeps over in our bed one night)
We were able to get some really great discounts due to my boyfriends military service, and Tom found the mattress I wanted at 50% from their warehouse. Walked out after my purchase with over $1,600 in savings and I am over the moon happy.
My biggest take away was the impeccable customer service, so thankful for Tom who fielded all of my questions and budget concerns.
Would recommend this place to anyone.

< review>
I came in a little bit before the 4th of July, yet they already had the sale started. Well, Antoinette helped us out so incredibly much that we were happy that we bought the bed from her. I still intend to get her a Subway gift card as a little thank you. She not only gave me a 10% discount on top of the sale, but made it 15% because I'm a veteran, despite the fact that I didn't have my vet ID on me, and took my word for it. Next, the computer wasn't working, so she took off another $300 to make our transaction an even $2000, which apparently helped the system process it. A friendly shoutout to the manager, Tony, who hooked us up with a free $200 pillow simply because there was some confusion about when our bed was getting delivered.</review>

<review>My whole family's been going here for years religiously, and each time I have a tire problem too far out in the bay where I can't ride on the spare for too long, I'm reminded how great they are. They outperform in price, confidence of technicians, time and friendliness whether compared to a chain or another small operation.

I've even got the tools and skills to change tires in my own garage, but between how fast San Martin Tire is and the price of my own time removing old tires, installing new ones, and properly balancing them, it's not even worth doing myself! I'm local, but I'd still come here to do tire stuff even if I lived in Sunnyvale, Fremont or Hollister.</review>< Gmap_id>

<rating>3</rating><Text>Stopped by for a tire repair, was kinda pricey $30 considering I brought in the bed of the truck and I did not have them reinstall it or the spare. They weren't very busy a did the work right away, but didn't rebalance the tire afterwards even though they removed a weight.

Edit
You told me $35 because I requested a plug patch, but you forgot to tell the technician,who installed a regular patch. When I balked at the price you told me it would be $30, but I do see that you only charged me $25 after checking my reciept. I can see the outline of where the wheel weight was removed so the the tire could be dismounted but it was never put back on and not balanced. FYI i am an ASE master technician.  Not sure how you can justify not balancing a wheel after removing material and then adding a patch, they're not weightless. Also you never quoted me a price to do they repair in the 1st place. Thank you for reaching out to address this but you too should include all the facts</Text><Pictures>None< /Pictures><response>{'time': 1597342218620, 'text': "Hi Scott, it was nice talking with you the other morning about your trip to Trinity. When posting a review we need to make sure that you are accurate. As you know, I didn't charge you $30 for the tire repair. I only charged you $25. We normally charge $30 for an LT load range E tires, however since you did bring it off the truck I discounted the repair.  In addition, to help you understand how a tire repair is done on most vehicles, we mark the tire with chalk before we take any weights off the wheel so we know exactly where to put them back on the wheel. This retains the balance of the tire on the wheel. This is how most shops do the repairs. We can certainly balance the wheel after the repair if requested. Thanks again for your business. EDIT: Thanks for your feedback. I also own Autoland in Santa Clara where I have 4 ASE Techs that work for me. If you want to get technical you are correct, the wheel should be balanced and for extra safety a plug patch should also be installed. Unfortunately, most people don't want to pay between $30 and $40 for a tire repair. We've used the same process for many years and never had any customers complain about the balance. Unless of course, we leave one of the weights off.  The employee who did your repair has been talked to and it shouldn't happen again. Thanks again, and please come back to have your wheel balanced at no charge."}<//response><GmapID>0x8091e1b20d69e36f:0xfdf1c25b6cdcec27</GmapID></record>

<rate>5< /rate>< Review>
San Martin Tires gets right down to the point, and gives you what you're looking for without any extra sales pitching, like Jiffy Lube or those other places that shove extras down your throat.

First look appearances, it doesn't look all spit shine and polished up, but the ratings on Google kept me pulling in. Glad I did.

I told them what I want, they quoted me a price and got me in and out in around 30 minutes.  The great part was the price they quoted per tire actually included ALL the extra stuff they do when they sell and mount tires.  (Some places only quote you the tire price... then the extras get tacked on at the register! Ug....  But when I looked at my receipt, there was no extra Ug!)

They back up their work with 3 free tire rotations, (KEEP THAT RECEIPT PEOPLE!!!). Today was a pleasant surprise indeed.<//Review>

Hello AT&T to whom this may concern,

I have been a loyal customer of AT&T for over 20 years and I have never experienced such horrible customer service until today.

I recently visited your store on Roscrans and Hindry on Tuesday, February 16th attempting to purchase my daughter a new gold or silver iPhone 12.

Brian was my representative and Andrea was the manager over the staff, who was quite rude to me and my family.

Allow me to explain - My partner walked into the AT&T store and asked the representative if they had the gold or silver IPhone 12 in stock (-as Apple product is very popular and color is important to teenagers). The representative then explained that they can not give out that specific information without first having my phone information. Well this request seemed weird and a little aggressive however I complied. In providing Brian with my phone number he consistently entered the wrong number into the system. Pulling up someone‚Äôs information named Melinda, I know this because he referred to me as Melinda. I exclaimed in a louder tone my cellular number, at least four times. After the fourth attempt Brain went to the back of the store and retrieved his Manager and explained that we were yelling at him. Interesting that he suddenly felt attacked when just moments earlier he engaged in small talk with us about his manager and her lack of customer service skills. Even explaining how he planned not to follow in her foot steps as she was running customers off.

At this point, the manager returns obviously upset and aggressive and approaches my family with a stern,‚ÄùIS THERE A PROBLEM‚Äù. Now this catches my family off guard as explained above our conversation with Brian was not hostile. My family and I explained that this was horrible customer service and choice to simply depart the store before the situation got worse.

Before leaving the parking lot we called the next closest store on Hawthorne and El Segundo and asked the same question, ‚ÄúDo you have the silver or gold IPhone 12 in stock at your store?‚Äù
The representative replied no but we have the blue, at this point my daughter was willing to sacrifice her favorite the color of choice. A simple request for a teenager, one would think? My family and I drove to
store on Hawthorne and El Segundo where a representative named William; was a gracious host and satisfied our needs as a family.

I am deeply disappointed in the service we received today from the AT&T representative and manager on Roscrans and Hindry and I hope that my letter lands into the hands of someone who can provide them with the proper personnel training and maybe even an exchange of my daughters phone to the gold or silver iPhone 12 she originally requested. We should not have to pay for their bad day.<//Text>

<text>Went to purchase a vehicle, negotiated a price or were trying to negotiate a price with the salesman who was actually very pleasant. He then moves on to the Toyota Venza (loved this car, test drove it) and says although the sticker price on the window says 32400 he is now marking it up 5000. When I asked why that was not posted on the sheet printed on the window he says they are working on printing that out as we speak and the one on the window is wrong. He says he can strike us a deal and sell it to us with only a 3000 mark up to help close the deal!!! My husband and I were completely confused. We had already ran numbers with the sticker price, payment and down payment with the sales person based on the sheet on the window dealer asking price. I would not recommend this place. We wasted time and I‚Äôm so glad we did not authorize them to run our credit until we had a verbal final price. It would have dinged my credit and just to be surprised that they have hidden mark ups from 2000 to 5000 which were not advertised. If advertised I would have not given the cars a second look and wasted my time. Salesman Fabrizio was completely professional and pleasant but they manager/supervisor(not sure) Luis was unprofessional , rude and ruined a sale for his salesman.</text>< Pictures>
None<//Pictures>

<review>Honesty...integrity  describe this great American family that ended up on the front page of the Times for "doing-the-right-thing...for us" (for a change!)

The Hogan Family stood-up to the giant and said basically..."until you ACTUALLY do correct the problem (that is hurting our customers) we aren't selling any more!"
Ouch! Oh Baby...that can hurt...Claremont Toyota is a leading sales point for Toyota's record breaking sales!
In today's world when profit seems to replace morals...it's  a blessing to see this company stand up for their customers.
The Hogans have always cared for their community...for real...(not just for publicity). They are heavily vested in giving to charities locally.
Care is their cornerstone of success! Real care, in this case may cost them money but that isn't what motivated their decision to stand-up for what's best for us. Integrity!
A huge THANK YOU!
On my top 10 Favorite American Companies

<Rate>1< /Rate>< review>
My dad and I called about a used car about a week ago, and told the salesman the price we were willing to pay. We live in San Diego and didn't want to drive 2 hours plus risk covid just to browse and haggle, especially with the risk of Covid. The salesman said he would call us back in a few days to let us know if he could match our price.
Turns out, he could match our price! He said he didn't want to waste our time and make us drive, so he guaranteed our price out the door on the phone before we drove up. I was excited and we drove on up.
We looked at the car, everything was great, and sat down to make it official.
At the last second, the manager said he didn't approve of the sale and wouldn't budge on the price we agreed on.
It's sad that Toyota Claremont is willing to mislead you and make false promises only to end up wasting your time on the lot. I find it dangerous that they knew we couldn't afford their price yet mislead us to get us to come out there knowing that there is a pandemic occurring.
Overall, don't waste people's time and possibly health to make a few bucks! Our time was wasted and we were promised a deal that you all fell through on.< /review>

< username>
Nathan Allen Meisenbach</username>
<review>Unprofessional customer service highlighted a visit that should have ended with a care sale. Instead the finale was highlighted by a ride home in my old car, laughing about the experience I will never forget.

Scams attempted: (in order of appearance)

1. Price of vehicle shown online didn't match Paper price. Made an obvious lie saying it was a mistake to cover for an attempt at hoping I was a negligent buyer. (warranty declinedat this point see below)

2. Initial finance data provided no break down. Only showed Monthly payment. I had to ask 3 times for a break down. They would not provide data on what financial institution was providing the loan. Sketchy as all what not tactics are a reoccurring theme.

2. Fake fees tacked on. Including a "weight fee" that magically brought the vehicle back up to the sticker price.

3. Inflated taxes. Which magically disappeared when I pointed out the math wasn't adding up.

4. The manager arrival technique. Without my prompting the sales person brought in the original data absent paperwork, and attempted to comment about the "great price" and how "cool" the car was. I had to ask again for a line item breakdown of costs, taxes, fees and whatever else was included in the final price.

5. The alarm is optional and you need it because people use their phones to steal cars these days scam. Let's all just apply common sense to this one.

6. The extended warranty brought back into price, even though I declined it at outset.

Other highlights:

The test drive was an education session for the... wait for it... sales associate who knew nothing about the car. If you don't know what you are trying to sell, people who deal in research like me will see right through your ruse.

I made a fair cash offer, and I mean fair. Which, because they weren't getting an in house finance they kept avoiding, and pushing the financing. a comment made at least three times. "Just finance it and you can pay it off early. there's no early termination fee, it doesn't hurt at all." Common sense people... will take you far. That is of course if mathematical analysis and simple interest formulas are part of your common culture.

When i made the cash offer, and said final offer or ill walk. they pushed financing again, which at this point is blatant rude bordering harassment, then proceeded to follow me outside to push it a final time.

This dealer is the real deal, if the deal you are looking for is an experience with how horrible dealership experiences can be.<//review></record>

When I went to take my Camry for the first service I was browsing at all the other camry‚Äôs they just got and I was obviously bothered because the last guy told me Toyota was no longer going to be making any more vehicles so they can aid with the pandemic.

<Text>I had been shopping for a Tacoma for a couple of months. I had contacted Claremont Toyota early on in my search as I had purchased a vehicle from them prior and was happy with the transaction. I made contact with Derrick Bates. He checked the stock and told me that they did not have one equipped as I wanted. Derrick mentioned that he would keep an eye out for one like I was looking for.

I continued my shopping. I contacted numerous dealers who said they had one like I was looking for. After going to the dealers and seeing that they were either just telling me they had one and then trying to replace it with something different or they inflated the price so high that the sale was ridiculous I was getting really burned out and was ready to just wait a few months.

Derrick contacted me as he had followed through on his promise to look for a vehicle for me. He said he had one in transit that would be the one I was looking for. I was very doubtful that he had the vehicle considering all of the problems I had with other dealers. He was very positive and attentive to my concerns.  He assured me that this was the correct vehicle for me. He put me in contact with the sales manager Alex Rosa. Alex confirmed the vehicle was in transit and he gave me a promise of what the price was going to be.

So I went to the dealer and contacted Derrick and Alex. They were both great. Both very sincere, helpful, and respectful of my time and came through on all of their promises. Something I did not think was going to happen.

Derrick brought me to the finance officer, Arturo Hermosillo. He was quick and very professional. No pressure.

Derrick, and Alex went so far beyond normal and out of their way to make this a honest, comfortable and perfect transaction.  Arturo made the finance section so easy and quick.

I could not be more satisfied with any purchase transaction. I am a very happy customer and will return to Claremont Toyota when the need arises for service or another vehicle.<//Text>< pictures>

I'm giving 2 stars instead of one because the main manager was nice. But let me tell you what happened.

I bought a corolla hybrid from here about a week ago. I spoke to someone on the phone and email telling me I can get a 21 corolla hybrid for $20,900. I had already gotten other dealerships down to around that price, so they said they'll beat it if I come today. So I went. Spoke to a guy named rick, I explained to him I wanted to trade in my car and get a new one. I told him I came because he told me this price(20,900). He says he can't do this price, and the lowest he can do is 21,500. I told him how I already had an offer for 21,000$ so there's no way. I got up to leave and Rick said give him a sec to talk to the manager. So he came back and said ok, they can sell me the car for 20,900. Even though I had to fight for a price he quoted me over the phone, I was happy.

That was a little problem compared to what happened next. So for my trade in, I told them I owe around 11,700 and kbb said it's worth 13k in fair condition, so I didn't care as long as they paid off my old car I would be happy. Rick said deal. Rick told me they're going to give me the full amount for my car(11,700) so it can be paid off. So when signing the paperwork for the new car, I noticed an extra $1200 added to my total price after taxes and fees. The guy that does the paperwork tells me that they were going to give me only 10,500 for my car so the 1200$ remaining balance would go into this new loan. Me and my girlfriend called rick over to talk about this and he pretty much lied to our face. He said that he never said this. He said that he told us we were only getting 10,500 for the trade in. He lied to our face. The main manager stepped in about an hour later to tell us they will give the full amount I owe for the car (11,700).

I was happy with my purchase! I love my car! But just want everyone to know to READ YOUR PAPERWORK! Don't take their word for it. Rick almost snuck in an extra 1200$ on my new loan. Don't let it happen to you.< /text>

<username>Albert Garcia<//username><rate>4< /rate><Text>I took my time writing this review, it's been a month since bought my car. I appreciate how they were while to help make my payments lower. Pablo was a really nice guy and he was responsible for getting me back there because he was will to bring down the price. I wish he was more knowledgeable about my particular car but with all makes and model I can't expect too much.
My problem came the 2nd day after purchasing the car. The warning light for a flat tire came on. I didn't think much of it because there was a weather change and that can change your tire pressure. It kept happening so I knew I had a small leak, I do have a long commute so I have no doubt it could have been a nail. When I took it to America Tires for repair they didn't feel comfortable patching it because the leak was coming from a plug already in the tire. The dealer told me they don't recommend patching these tires, instead replace the whole tire. So it bugs me that they didn't let me know about the plug, in my experience a plug is worst than a patch. I would have had them put new tires on and add it to my overall payment.
To be fair the plug could have been put in by the previous owner. I can't say that they knew about the plug in the first place. My overall experience was good. They are willing to work with you, just do your research and ask lots of questions.</Text><response>None</response>< time>

< Time>
1468986694713< /Time>
< review>
My experience at Claremont  Toyota which will be listed was a largely negative experience. However, I will mention both the good and the bad.

The Good:
The environment was extremely cleanly and all of the lower level staff were extremely polite at all times.
The shuttle service for those seeking to go elsewhere is free and fast.

The bad: I went in for a recalled airbag, I made an appointment, showed up and was informed the car part had not arrived  and that they were sorry, sales offered to fill up my tank next time which I accepted. The repair takes 6 hours although I am initially told 4.  My shuttle back is an uncomfortable half hour listening to (not my choice) conservative talk radio and hearing the driver tell me how great Donald Trump is.

When I inquired over the delay management bristled, insisting that this is "normal" that an appointment didn't really mean you would get your car repairs would get started but was an arbitrary placeholder.  When I went to sales (as the service manager had left for the day) I was sold a barnyard variety of excuses. Rather than anything resembling accountability.

Bottom Line:  I did not take the gasoline.  They are untrustworthy and unprofessional. These are not traits I seek in my mechanic, or my car dealer.<//review>

Made me think that the other Toyota location was trying to make a sell and have me purchase a service I did not need. Tony also gave me a coupon for my service which was greatly appreciated. Definitely recommend Tony Sanchez for your service needs. Thanks Tony!<//text>< Rate>

< Text>
I just wanna say how happy I am with my car buying experience from Claremont Toyota! Starting off with Edgar who walked up and introduce himself to me and my wife when we where just walking around the lot looking at trucks. He explained all the options that came with the truck and also explained all the other models they had in the truck I wanted. He was very nice to me and my wife and actually took the time to get to know us and not just pressure us into buying a truck that day. We left that day because our other car was done getting it's oil change but left Edgar my phone number so he can follow up with me. Edgar called me on Saturday afternoon to see if I was still interested in buying a truck and I told him yes but also asked if they are a part of the Costco auto program which he told me yes and said he would have Peter the fleet sales manager give me a call. Peter called me on Sunday and we where able to get pre approved for the truck i was looking at even before I went down there to start negotiating for the monthly payment i was trying to meet. As soon as I got there Peter and Edgar both greeted me and had the truck ready for me to test drive. We took the truck out for a spin and Peter really got to know me and I really got to know him, he just wasn't trying to make a sale he really had an interest in me as a person. I told him about my bad experience I had at Puente Hills Toyota and how they didn't care about me only about how bad my credit was and they where not trying to work with me at all. After the test drive we went and sat down in his office and and it was the easiest negotiation I have ever done. I was up front and honest with him told peter where I needed to be on the monthly payments and how much I wanted to give as a down payment. He went to his manger to make sure he could give me the deal he was thinking about and when he came back and gave me the numbers I was shocked!!!!! He actually got my payments to the budget I was sticking too. I called my wife to tell her the news and we left with a new truck that night. And my buddy in finance Sal he was the best also made all the paperwork fast and easy for us so we could get out of there. He was also very entertaining and he got to know us as well while we waited.
Peter, Edgar and Sal I just want to say thank you for making my car buying experience easy and fast. You guys really took care of me, you saw past my bad credit and did your all to get me the best deal ever!!! Thank you guys for everything will definitely recommend Claremont Toyota to family and friends and definitely buying my next car there.< /Text>

<name>Doug Wilson< /name><date>1548954560532< /date><Rate>5< /Rate>< review>
I came in to look at a used car with Claremont and was helped almost immediately. Unfortunately the car had sold, but Jae and Raffi were only too helpful to find out some other options to get me into another car.

Unfortunately, I had little time to find a new car and impulsively bought a Corolla XSE hatchback that I had done little research on and bought it without walking away and considering the size of the car being too small for me. One of the worse mistakes any car buyer can do. A week later I took it back to the dealership to see what my options were to exchange the car. While Raffi and his sales team tried to make options that would work for me, I was going to lose quite a substantial sum of money on the sale and decided not to go through with exchanging the vehicle and buying another.

Jae and Raffi followed up to see what else could be done but kindly I thanked them for there time and decided to keep and pay off the car.

Would recommend this dealership with there kindness and service. Unfortunately, I was the one that made the mistake and they did there best to help me out of a poor car buying decision.< /review>

I said, "You want us to go all the way home, find the receipt from 2004 and bring it all the way back just so you can update your system?!" I looked at my dad and said, "You know what we don't need to bring the car here, we can go somewhere else." <name>Joshua Wrye< /name>< Review>
I recently purchased another vehicle from Claremont Toyota. When I came in for my first "free" oil change, they explained to me that a couple of years ago they stopped offering "free lifetime" oil changes. Now, in order to get a "free" oil change, you have to purchase the basic service ($54/avg.) first.

I understand times are tough for everyone and all businesses, but this type of service was one of the main reasons I was so loyal to Claremont Toyota.

After talking to the maintenance manager about this issue, he offered me two $10 vouchers to Wahoo's Tacos and basically told me, "sorry, but that's just the way it is now" and "your salesman should've explained it to you better." Um, yeah, he should've told me that things had changed since the last time I purchased a vehicle here.

Even so, I'm still a fan of Claremont Toyota. The other day I went in to purchase some parts for our car and the parts guy applied all of the current coupons even though we didn't have them with us (his name is Pete). Thanks, Pete, for keeping us happy!< /Review>

< review>
wanted to share my thoughts with the google community regarding my experiences.so i have been a long time toyota owner, family members also! been coming to the toyota dealers for service for quite some years now. at first hand i know what to expect. you need this you need that. so the journey begins! back some years ago i met this nice young fellow when i brought my vehicle in for service and check engine light was on! i knew what the check engine light code was. i kindly asked him if he could check it out for me. no problem he replied. after all he said "you are getting a major service done, it's the least we could do for you! so we agreed on leaving my vehicle over night. didn't want a rush job on my vehicle. next morning i get a call for jeremy wright (my service advisor at claremont) he said. he bud i got some good news for you! i was like here we go..the mechanic told him i have a lean code p0171, most likely i would need to have my mass air flow cleaned! recently i had been getting my car service at elmore toyota. that's where jeremy wright had been previously employed, the service advisor at elmore toyota had told me i needed new catalytic converter and was gonna be over $1900 dollars! so we had talked about doing a EFI service and cleaning the mass air flow. he insured to me that its not a service that i would be getting a guarantee. what does that mean? i replied. jeremy explained to me that if what the technician was about to do didn't fix the problem i would not be charged! now that's a guarantee. guess what he was so confident in his mechanic it fixed the problem! that was really good news. he saved me butt loads of money. jeremy wright is a really nice guy, he treated my like i was a brother! do your self a favor save some money and aggravation, go see jeremy!</review>
